revised_title: Anatomy and Function of the Human Ear: Membrana Tympani, Ossicles, and Eustachian Tube
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Anatomy and Physiology
tldr: The author, Joseph Toynbee, examines the functions of the membrana tympani, ossicles, and Eustachian tube in the human ear. He explains how the tensor tympani and stapedius muscles work together to protect the ear from loud vibrations and receive faint undulations. Additionally, he discusses the role of the Eustachian tube in maintaining air pressure in the middle ear and how it opens during swallowing.
